meanings.definition: An abrupt, uncontrolled movement or series of movements.
meanings.sent1: The boat hit a big wave and took a sudden lurch to the side.
meanings.sent2: The car came to a sudden lurch as the driver slammed on the brakes.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's lurch across the room was more of a wobble than a walk.
meanings.sent4: The market experienced a lurch in prices after the unexpected news.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster's lurch at the top of the hill made everyone scream.

meanings.definition: To make an abrupt, uncontrolled movement.
meanings.sent1: She felt the boat lurch as it hit a big wave.
meanings.sent2: The bus driver had to lurch to avoid hitting the animal on the road.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to lurch gracefully onto the high shelf but ended up knocking things over.
meanings.sent4: His heart seemed to lurch in his chest when he saw the unexpected sight.
meanings.sent5: The sudden gust of wind caused the tree to lurch dangerously.

meanings.sent1: He felt his stomach lurch as the elevator suddenly dropped.
meanings.sent2: The horse began to lurch forward as soon as the gate opened.
meanings.sent3: The balloon seemed to lurch in the air as it struggled against the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her heart seemed to lurch in her chest when she saw the ghostly figure.
meanings.sent5: The car started to lurch forward when the driver accidentally hit the gas pedal.
